Job Title: Salesforce Senior Project Manager

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Who are we?Founded in 2005, Pierce Washington helps clients transform their quote-to-cash process. We are creating a next-generation Total Commerce Company and will own the Total Commerce category – a fast growing segment in the tech industry. This is the place to come to if you want to work with the best, get in at the ground floor and help sustain and grow one of the best places to work. We have completed over 100 CPQ projects enabling leading enterprise companies like ADP, CDK Global, NetApp and Schneider Electric to achieve their most complex Q2C process automation goals and transform how they do business.
Leveraging this expertise, our Salesforce Practice is focused on delivering Salesforce Revenue Cloud solutions to clients in the High Tech and Manufacturing industries. Come join a growing Salesforce Practice and work on fun projects with good people!
Who are you?You are an experienced Salesforce Project Manager, who has experience managing enterprise level projects. You enjoy being a hands-on business analyst while managing complex projects and delivering excellence for your clients. As the client’s main point of contact, you will establish a comprehensive understanding of project expectations and business processes and manage a plan to meet these goals.
You strive for and deliver excellence for yourself, your team, and your clients. You have a natural curiosity to uncover a client’s pain points, key requirements and implicit needs, provide day-to-day leadership and timely project status updates to our clients, and work closely with Pierce Washington and client technical and non-technical team members to complete projects on-time and within budget. This will be a 100% remote position.
What you get to do:Working closely with the Solution Architect, you will create and execute project work plans and revise as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirementsIn this capacity, you will lead, or co-lead with the Solution Architect, completion of the following business analyst functions:discovery workshops to gather, define, and document current and future state business processes and functional requirementsdocument requirements in the form of process flow diagrams and user storiesdevelop implementation estimates and plans for phases of the delivery lifecycle, including configuration, development, testing, training, communications, deployment, and post go-live supportdesign user story test scripts and participate in end-user acceptance testingManage the day-to-day operational aspects of the project and scope, the overall client relationship and demonstrate respect and responsiveness to client needsCultivate and manage highly functional teams comprised of Solution Architects, Consultants and Developers and client resources through all phases of an Agile Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) to define and validate the technical approach, strategy and deliverables for the projectManage project deliverables, financials and schedule to ensure the project stays on track and drive implementation of the solutionMonitor project status and assess risk in process, people and/or technology and adjust project plans to address accordinglyPerform impact analysis for scope change requests and document changes to requirementsServe as an expert in Agile methodology to effectively apply our delivery methodology and enforce project standardsEnsure successful completion of project deliverables, cost, and timelinesMaintain a sense of ownership as it pertains to client satisfaction, company profitability and project team resource workloadProvide clear and effective communication on risks, scope changes and an understanding of change management techniques and processes
What you bring to the role:4+ years of Salesforce industry experience in a consulting capacity as a Business Analyst and/or Project Manager working with the Sales Could and/or Service Cloud --- must have experience managing enterprise level projects2+ years of hands-on experience managing Enterprise Salesforce CPQ projects that were at least 6 months in duration and included data migrations and integrations with ERP systemsExperience with Salesforce org consolidation/migration projects a bonuProven expert in Agile SDLC project management theories, practices and methodsAbility to serve as a liaison between both business and technical teams to drive effective, timely solutions that fulfill both strategic and operational needsExperienced in executing gap analysis and requirements traceability matricesExcellent client-facing written and oral communication skillsAbility to pivot and adapt in a fast-paced environmentAbility to challenge, innovate, lead and drive projects to closeExperienced with Visio, Jira, Confluence, Prodly, Copado, or similar tools desirableExperience in the High Tech or Manufacturing industries highly desiredPMP certification is preferredActive Salesforce certifications or ability to achieve relevant certifications upon hire within first several monthsPreferred Salesforce certifications: AdministratorExperience in High Tech or Manufacturing industries highly desiredBachelor’s degree in business, computer science or information systems
What we’ll do for you:Competitive compensation packageHealth, vision, dental, life & disability insuranceFlexible, collaborative work environment with a commitment to work life balanceWork anywhere, with full remote and hybrid options depending on locationLearn and challenge yourself in a fast-paced, growing tech company
More about us:Since 2005, Pierce Washington has helped enterprises transform their quote-to-cash process in four ways: we implement CPQ, eCommerce and Billing & Subscription Management solutions and we integrate those solutions to ERP and other enterprise systems. By focusing on these four areas – and doing them well – we have built our reputation as the go-to partner for our clients. Our commitment to each client’s success is the foundation on which Pierce Washington was built. None of this success would have been possible without the synergy we have with our employees. Our commitment to each employee’s personal growth and development yet still highly valuing work/life balance, all within a culture of collaboration and teamwork, is why being a part of our team is an exciting next step in your career!

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
